critique: The president is conveying a sense of joy and surprise with the document. The president is attempting to portray joy and surprise with the document by directing the Civil Service Commission to add five points to the earned ratings of young men and women who served in the World War. The president is also directing the Civil Service Commission to reckon the time such candidates were in the service during the World War in making up the required length of business experience and to waive all age limitations. The president is not attempting to portray sadness, anger, fear, or disgust with the document.
